task.summary:
Chapter 12 .2
The set of primitives (map2 and unit) is equivalently expressive as the set of (apply and unit)

Chapter 12 .6
Overrode map2 to ensure proper propogation of errors

Chapter 12 .12
Basically implemented traverse but specialized

Start of Chapter13
External effect s and I/O
Create a restricted IO type allowing only console IO
Example of application with pureMain method
Start of chapter 14. Example of purely functional mutable state. The mutation is locally scoped and hidden from anything outside of the quicksort function

Exercise 14.2
Pure in-line quicksort that mutates the data it recieves but in a safe way

Exercise 14.3
Built a functionally pure mutable HashMap

Chapter 15: Stream processing and incremental I/O
imperative example of checking if file is over 40,000 lines long using the IO monad.
Not very composable

Chapter 15.2: Simple stream transducers (or processors)
Process

Chapter 15.2: Simple stream transducers (or processors)
Added repeat to Process that will repeat the same process forever

Chapter 15.2: Simple stream transducers (or processors)
Added filter Process that awaits some input and if it matches the predicate emits it the output. The call to repeat makes sure the Process keeps going until the input stream is exhausted.

Chapter 15.2: Simple stream transducers (or processors)
Added sum
